etymologies: late 19th century. From the name of Sir Henry Roscoe, English chemist + -lite

definitions: A vanadium-containing mineral of the mica group, occurring as minute greenish or brownish scales.

notes.text: Roscoelite is a silicate and hydroxide of potassium, vanadium, and aluminium, K(V,Al,Mg)₂AlSi₃O₁₀(OH)₂. Crystal system: monoclinic.
